intro: Swainsona longicarinata, commonly known as the long-winged swainsona, is a flowering plant native to parts of South America. It is a shrub or small tree that can grow up to 5 meters in height, characterized by its slender, often branching stems. The plant produces showy, yellow flowers that are clustered in racemes, typically blooming during the dry season. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and have a rough texture, while its seeds are enclosed in elongated, woody pods. Swainsona longicarinata is adapted to arid environments and is often found in savannas and dry forests.
